verse: Ezekiel, son of man, condemn the people of Ammon
The Lord God said, “The people of Moab thought Judah was no different from any other nation.
So I will let Moab’s fortress towns along its border be attacked, including Beth-Jeshimoth, Baal-Meon, and Kiriathaim.
The same eastern desert tribes that invade Ammon will invade Moab, and just as Ammon will be forgotten forever,
Moab will be punished. Then the people there will know that I am the Lord.”
The Lord God then said, “The people of Edom are guilty of taking revenge on Judah.
So I will punish Edom by killing all its people and livestock. It will be an empty wasteland all the way from Teman to Dedan.
I will send my own people to take revenge on the Edomites by making them feel my fierce anger. And when I punish them, they will know that I am the Lord God.”
The Lord God said, “The cruel Philistines have taken revenge on their enemies over and over and have tried to destroy them.
Now it’s my turn to treat the Philistines as my enemies and to kill everyone living in their towns along the seacoast.
In my fierce anger, I will take revenge on them. And when I punish them, they will know that I am the Lord.”
